definition: to grumble/to complain/grievance
variant of 訴|诉[su4]
to complain/to sue/to tell
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly

sentences.english: She start complaining and m aunts, said m blue too have an idea.
sentences.chinese: 罗梅开始和米婶诉苦，说米蓝“太”有主意了。

sentences.english: Tassels on the horns of a dilemma, back to the husbands family and no steps, had to find treasure complex complaint.
sentences.chinese: 流苏进退两难，回婆家又没台阶，只得找宝络诉苦。

sentences.english: Workers complain to the boss of their overwork.
sentences.chinese: 因为工作过度，工人向老板诉苦。

sentences.english: But I would not sadden you by the mortal plaint.
sentences.chinese: 但是我不会用这致命的诉苦来使你忧伤。

sentences.english: He sat in a corner of the room canting and whining.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在房间的一个角落里一边哀求一边诉苦。

sentences.english: The old woman bleated (out) her complaints.
sentences.chinese: 老妇人以颤抖的声音诉苦。

sentences.english: He who makes constish complaint gets little compbuttion.
sentences.chinese: 时常诉苦衔恨，难以取得怜悯。

sentences.english: Mmuch people complain that computers take over their jobaloney.
sentences.chinese: 许多人诉苦说计算机正在收受人的作事。

sentences.english: A tramp came and made a poor mouth to Mrs Robeson.
sentences.chinese: 一流浪汉走来向罗伯逊夫人叫穷诉苦。

sentences.english: Bing and argue, honor with customers, we appealed to grasp bitterness toward refers to a third party.
sentences.chinese: 秉又与客户争执，荣劝解秉，秉向荣诉苦指有第三者。

sentences.english: Palmer the temple to find their own lover complaining of elder sister Ann.
sentences.chinese: 帕巴坦去找自己的相好颂安大姐诉苦。

sentences.english: Naomi gets into God's story by complaining.
sentences.chinese: 拿俄米在神的故事中以诉苦出场。

sentences.english: Then don’t complain to me when Spanish gets boring.
sentences.chinese: 当你觉得西班牙语令你厌烦的时候，别向我诉苦。

sentences.english: His amiability condemns him to being a constant listener to other people's troubles.
sentences.chinese: 他的和蔼可亲使他经常处于倾听他人诉苦的地位。

sentences.english: Meaning : (Informal) To complain naggingly or constantly; grumble.
Her constant complaining just sticks in my craw .
sentences.chinese: 她那不断的诉苦真使我受不了。

definition: to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to have bitter digestive fluids rising to the mouth/fig. to complain bitterly/to pour out one's sufferings
to pour out one's grievances
to whine/to be grouchy
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
to pour forth (one's opinions)
to bewail one's poverty/to complain about being hard up/to pretend to be poor
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
bitter water (e.g. mineral water containing sulfates)/suffering/digestive fluids rising from stomach to the mouth/fig. bitter complaint
to comfort/to console/CL:個|个[ge4]
to feel wronged/to cause sb to feel wronged/grievance
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to complain/to grumble (about)/to reproach/to blame
to accuse/to denounce/to make a complaint against/denunciation
